choices.text:
using drugs and alcohol – the little ones are already using them.

Thus school going kids are not exempted they are also smoking Panga – and medicines or drugs that are used to kill ants and cockroaches.

According to The Voice, some of the teens and underage school kids have been caught smoking Panga while going to and from classes.

Munya Thobejane the Mmathethe ward Councillor in Tutume who has power to suspend or fire the teachers who were seen smoking Panga with the students however told The Voice that he

would not take disciplinary action against them but work with the teachers and learners to help them overcome the drug crisis.

Writing in The Voice on Tuesday, Thobejane said he had been informed that a male teacher and three female teachers were seen smoking Panga while in the company of learners leaving the school for school time lessons.

After a meeting with the teachers in his office, Thobejane said he moved heaven and earth to remove such Panga from their hands.

This revelation comes after a Rockland Primary deputy headteacher Aliska Mashall was suspended after an incident, where he used abusive language against one of the children at school on Friday last week. The suspension clearly states that Mashall will be absent from duty and will report to the Botswana Teachers Council upon completion of relevant investigations.

Speaking to The Voice this week, Thobejane said his intention was to stop the teachers smoking and drinking Panga with their learners which according to
